alert.note: Alert for Maries; Phelps; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 1:49PM CDT until May 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Maries and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Piney Creek at Highway H, Smoky Hollow at Highway J, Norman Creek at County Road 4220, Montague Creek at County Road 510 and Dry Fork at County Road 407. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rolla, St. James, Belle, Doolittle, Vienna, Newburg, Edgar Springs and Northwye. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
